intro: Lessingianthus vestitus, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and bright yellow ray flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable addition to botanical collections.
